newsitem.title: USA: N.Y. Assembly Republicans see higher FY 97&98 revs.
newsitem.headline: N.Y. Assembly Republicans see higher FY 97&98 revs.

text.p: New York Assembly Republicans, citing the state's strong general fund revenues, projected $729 million more in revenue than the executive budget estimates for fiscal years 1997 and 1998, according to a report released Thursday.
The Republicans, the minority party in that chamber, projected $193 million more in revenue in fiscal 1997 and $536 million in fiscal 1998.
The state's fiscal year starts April 1.
